name: RECONCILE_CLM
description: This table contains basic information for claim reconciliation records.

columns.name: CLAIM_REC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the claim reconciliation record.

columns.name: CLAIM_INVOICE_NUM
columns.description: The invoice number of the claim.

columns.name: CUR_EPIC_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description: This is the system status of the claim: opened or closed.

columns.name: PAYOR_ID_PAYOR_NAME
columns.description: The name of the payor.

columns.name: BENEFIT_PLAN_ID_BEN_PACKAGE_NAME
columns.description: *** Deprecated *** In table CLARITY_EPP_OT, the column BEN_PACKAGE_NAME (CMK .2) has been deprecated.  This column already exists as BENEFIT_PACKAGE_NM (CMK .2) in table CL_CMK. To look up the deprecated column's value after the Clarity Compass upgrade, join column CLARITY_EPP_OT.BEN_PACKAGE_ID to table CL_CMK column BENEFIT_PACKAGE_ID and get the BENEFIT_PACKAGE_NM value.   The name of the benefit package for this benefit plan.The ID of the benefit package is in the column BEN_PACKAGE_ID.

columns.name: LOC_ID_LOC_NAME
columns.description: The name of the revenue location.

columns.name: DEPARTMENT_ID_EXTERNAL_NAME
columns.description: The external name of the department record. This is often used in patient correspondence such as reminder letters.

columns.name: BUCKET_ID
columns.description: The hospital liability bucket ID for the claim. This column is populated only for Hospital Billing claims.

columns.name: HSP_ACCOUNT_ID
columns.description: The hospital account ID for the claim. This column is populated only for Hospital Billing claims.

columns.name: SERVICE_AREA_ID_LOC_NAME
columns.description: The name of the revenue location.

columns.name: EPIC_CLM_STS_C_NAME
columns.description: This column stores the status of the claim that created the reconciliation record. This column will indicate whether the claim has been accepted, processed, or rejected in Epic.

columns.name: CLAIM_RUN_ID
columns.description: This column stores the claim run ID for the reconciliation record. This column will be populated for records created in the 2010 version and beyond.

columns.name: TOTAL_BILLED
columns.description: This column stores the billed amount for the reconciliation record.

columns.name: EXT_STS_RCV_YN
columns.description: This column indicates whether at least one external status update has been received for the reconciliation record.

columns.name: CROSSOVER_CLAIM_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the associated claim is a crossover claim.

columns.name: RECORD_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description: This item indicates whether the record is Interchange Control Header (ISA), Transaction Set Header (ST), or Claim data.

columns.name: ISA_CONTROL_NUM
columns.description: This item holds a unique value used for tracking an interchange for records of type Interchange.

columns.name: GS_CONTROL_NUM
columns.description: This item holds a unique value used for tracking a transaction set for records of type Transaction Set.

columns.name: NUM_OF_CLAIMS
columns.description: This item holds the number of claims submitted. It is set for records of type Interchange and Transaction Set.

columns.name: PRINT_USER_ID
columns.description: This item holds the user associated with the print event. Set only for records of type Interchange.

columns.name: PRINT_USER_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

columns.name: BHT_REF_NUM
columns.description: The reference identifier (BHT-03) value from the electronic claim file generated out of Epic. This acts as a link to the receiver level reference identifier (TRN-02) in the claim reconciliation (277CA) response file.

columns.name: POST_ACK_STATUS_YN
columns.description: This item indicates whether at least one external status update has been received on or after either four days post claim acceptance or the predicted payment response date if earlier. Claim acknowledgements are generally posted before then.

columns.name: AP_CLAIM_IMPORT_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description: Used to define the type of source a claim is imported from to drive reporting on the different use cases a single workflow type may have.

columns.name: SOURCE_GROUP_ID_LOC_NAME
columns.description: The name of the revenue location.

columns.name: MC_PROV_ACCT_NUM
columns.description: This item stores the provider account number (invoice number) of the rejected claim.

columns.name: REJ_CLM_SVC_DATE
columns.description: This item stores the service date of the rejected claim.

columns.name: REJ_CLM_MEMBER_ID
columns.description: This item stores the matched member of the rejected claim, if one was identified during claim load.

columns.name: REJ_CLM_VENDOR_ID
columns.description: This item stores the matched vendor of the rejected claim, if one was identified during claim load.

columns.name: REJ_CLM_VENDOR_ID_VENDOR_NAME
columns.description: The name of the vendor.

columns.name: REJ_CLM_PROV_ID_PROV_NAME
columns.description: The name of the service provider. This item may be hidden in a public view of the CLARITY_SER table.

columns.name: REJ_CLM_POS_ID_LOC_NAME
columns.description: The name of the revenue location.

columns.name: CLAIM_CLOSED_DATE
columns.description: This item holds the contact date the CRD was marked closed.
